metadata.title: CVE-2021-41500 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Incomplete string comparison vulnerability exits in cvxopt.org cvxop <=1.2.6 in APIs (cvxopt.cholmod.diag, cvxopt.cholmod.getfactor,cvxopt.cholmod.solve, cvxopt.cholmod.spsolve), which allows attackers toconduct Denial of Service attacks by construct fake Capsule objects.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-cvxopt - 1.2.7+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cvxopt package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.7+dfsg-2').
